property.name: text
property.value:
This design consists of a model of a controler (T-REX) and a plant mode (the rest of the design. The plant models the dynamics of a DC motors driving a feed roller and a controler to cause the resulting paper velocity to track the input profile. All of this is a subset of the larger printing press model.
The T-REX control takes as input sensors detecting top dead center of the roll, the present of the tape, and an arming signal. It outputs actuation signals: Contact to the device forcing the primary feed paper into the reserve paper, Cut to the device to cut the primary feed paper.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model has been edited to remove all analog inputs from the TREX controller. Specifically the reservePaperRadiusSEN input has been replaced by the CONTS '1' event (black arrow) which internally triggers a second CONST with the value 0.7, e.g. the initial reserve paper radius. Thus the computed values in the TREX controller will be correct ONLY until the paper is cut. Likewise the output of this logic path has been changed by inserting a CONST '1' event prior to output to the reservePaperVelocityACT actuator. Thus the former analog output is now a digital output and can only be used to verify timing. The Model Delay display shows the measured value of input to output delay on the logic path which agrees with the model delay actor in the TREX controller.
The red arrows indicate the location where the former signal reservePaperVelocityACT has been replaced in the plant actor inputs by the paperVelocityCONT signal from the plant model reserveFeedRoller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The feedRoller is a cylinder of radius coreRadius with the paper of thickness delta extending to a radius actualRollRadius which for a full roll is fullRollRadius.
The actual radius Q = R(1-delta*theta/(2*pi)) where theta is roller angle.
theta = integral of omega
The dc motor-roller dynamics are given by the transfer function: omega/V = K/{(Js +b)(Ls - R) +K^2} where: omega is the angularVelocity V in the input voltage K is the eletromotive force constant (Nm/Amp) J is the moment of iertia b is the damping ration in Nms R is the armature resistance in ohms L is the inductance in henrys
The resulting equation to be solved is: d^2(omega)/(dt)^2 = KV/(LJ) -(R/L +b/J)*d(omega)/dt - (b*R + K^2)*omega/(JL)
The velocity of the paper is that of a point on the surface of the roller, namely paperVelocity = (d(omega)/dt)*pi*2*R It is assumed that the paper does NOT slip while travelling over the roller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The actor computes the current radius (in meters) of the remaining paper on the roller. The initial radius is initialRadius which is decreased by the paper thickness, paperThickness, (in meters)every revolution of the roller after receipt of a signal contact = 1. The number of revolutions since start is given by theta, the roller angle in radians divided by 2 pi. theta is the integral of omega the roller angular velocity.The paper does not start to unwind until contact is true.
If only percentFullRoll% of the initial paper mass remains on the roll, the initialRadius is given by:
initialRadius = sqrt{ coreRadius^2 + (percentFullRoll/100)*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)
Once the radius reaches coreRadius it remains there even if the input theta oscillates due to transients.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the moment of inertia j in kg*m^2/s^2 given the radius of the paper on the roller, paperRadius, in meters, the mass of the paper on a full roll, massOfFullRoll, in kg, the radius of a full roll, fullRollRadius, in meters, the radius of the inner core, coreRadius, in meters and the mass of the inner core including the motor armature, coreMass, in kg.
The formula is:
J= (coreMass*coreRadius^2)/2 + massOfFullRoll*(paperRadius^4 - coreRadius^4)/[2*(fullRollRadius^2 - coreRadius^2)]

property.name: text
property.value: This actor produces a ramp starting at time 0 with value 0, ramping to a constant value of maxPaperVelocity at time 350 when the actor boolean parameter ramp is true. When false the actor produces a step funtion with final value maxPaperVelocity at time 0.5.

property.name: text
property.value: This is the TREX application single platform controller. The analog signal input and output have been removed and replaced with digital signals to simplify implementation on XMOS and to enable run-time testing.

property.name: text
property.value: This actor models the controller circuit board and the controller microprocessor. The board models the ADC and the network NIC and PHY.

property.name: text
property.value:
The controller is a PID controller that minimizes the error signal which is the difference between the target velocity profile and the measured velocity. The relative error input is a correction signal to permit modification of the target output, for example if this drive is to track another drive operating with the same target profile but with minor differences.
When a cut event is received the drive is shut off by setting the output voltage to 0.
The register actors are required since the sensor sampling is not necessarily at the same frequency as the frequency of receipt of profile information.

property.name: text
property.value: 1 causes const 0 to be used as the input

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.name: text
property.value: Produces a true event every time theta, the integral of omega (the angular velocity) exceeds a multiple of 2 pi corresponding to top dead center. A second output is produced at an angle tapeAngle later.
